official-title.#text: To amend part D of title XVIII of the Social Security Act to require the Secretary of Health and Human Services to negotiate covered part D drug prices on behalf of Medicare beneficiaries.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Medicare Prescription Drug Price Negotiation Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Negotiation of lower covered part D drug prices on behalf of medicare beneficiaries

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (relating to noninterference) and inserting the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1860D–11 of the Social Security Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall negotiate with pharmaceutical manufacturers the prices (including discounts, rebates, and other price concessions) that may be charged to PDP sponsors and MA organizations for covered part D drugs for part D eligible individuals who are enrolled under a prescription drug plan or under an MA–PD plan.

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be construed to authorize the
to establish or require a particular formulary.
shall not be construed as affecting the
authority to ensure appropriate and adequate access to covered part D drugs under prescription drug plans and under MA–PD plans, including compliance of such plans with formulary requirements under

header.#text: No change in rules for formularies

text.#text: Nothing in this subsection shall be construed as preventing the sponsor of a prescription drug plan, or an organization offering an MA–PD plan, from obtaining a discount or reduction of the price for a covered part D drug below the price negotiated under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Oversight and Government Reform of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report on negotiations conducted by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Finance of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to achieve lower prices for Medicare beneficiaries, and the prices and price discounts achieved by the
as a result of such negotiations.

text.#text: Not later than June 1, 2014, and every 6 months thereafter, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act and shall first apply to negotiations and prices for plan years beginning on January 1, 2014.
